reviewText:
I tried, I really tried to get into the game. I spent as long as I could but unfortunately it was difficult for me to stay playing. I did come up with a small list for pros and cons and I apologize for not getting a better list:

Pros:

- Decent music
- Class variety
- Cute female outfits
- Unique weapons not usually seen in other mmos (Gladiator Chakra)
- Easy to use combat system
- Dated Graphics, not terrible but extremely dated. I got a PS1 feel from it. Lot of people probably wouldn't like it though
- FPS, being an older game, I was hitting about 100 FPS, which is always nice in any game.

Cons:

- Security Codes, if anything turns me off faster it's telling me I have to protect my account two and three times more with ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t.

- Bugs, specifically with the warehouse not working or loading and trying to chat with nothing I said showing up, which as a newbie made it super difficult to ask a question.

- Clunky UI, couldn't really find everything I needed and most of the windows were almost too big.

- Unclear Text, Had a lot of issues with the red text, mostly, it felt like there was almost too much and made it hard to identify why it was red. Some items were highlighted as not red, though my character still couldnt wear it, and the info never seemed to declare why.

-Simplified Questing, In 2 hours of play, only one quest was a fetch quest, the others were nothing but hunt this and dungeon that or warp here.

- Automated fighting, when I played as a Shielder, my skills worked automatically, I don't know how I got it to work but it made the game even harder to enjoy. Some might like that, but I didn't.

- Objective KSing, Monsters can be kill stolen, making it super impossible to get certain quest done as any class that isn't a dps character such as the force shielder. For me, since it happened way too often, was really the first worst impression a game could give.



I think I might have missed something but it's hard for me to remember atm. I might come back and edit more in, but I've already uninstalled the game. Don't bother wasting your time with this one, too much of a headache and hardly enjoyable unless you're a die-hard fan.

Edit: I see that a lot of people are saying this review isn't helpful because either I have no answer for the loading issues or region locking, and I don't. Please don't take it out on me, take it to the dev's support page please. Link is here: https://www.estgames.com/CABAL/en/Support

Also, I apologize if you happen to be a die hard fan and I gave a bad review about your favorite mmo, I had never heard of this mmo prior to steam this week, and I didn't know what to expect, I had a good feeling at character select but for me I did at least expect a bit of uniqueness from the game and it let me down. Sorry that you expect me to love the game, I just couldn't.

I'm trying to accept friendly comments, but a lot of what you people have to say has been telling me to kill myself or otherwise agreeing that I should. I've only asked that if you have an opinion that you keep it respectful, and people cannot even do that. Do not be surprised if your comment is deleted. I still hold the right to do so, if you cannot be mature about your post.

reviewText:
I played CABAL Online for about 3 months nonstop a couple of years ago. The only reason I stopped was I got back into WoW hardcore for a while. I kind of forgot about the game, so I'm excited to see it pop up on Steam.

https://youtu.be/kRbSm9IF_hE

CABAL is not a new game, and you can definitely tell that right off the bat. But it doesn't play badly like some older MMOs do. You just have to deal with some kind of ugly outdated quest texts/fonts and some iffy (yet readable) translations. You can click to move if you want, or use WASD (or reassign keys to whatever you want). I don't care for the camera very much, honestly.

The combat is pretty fun and low stress. The classes are about what you'd expect, your general MMO variety. They do play quite differently from eachother though- very unique. It's essentially a themepark with some neat mechanics. PVP is fun, but very DPS-focused (tanks and healers don't really play much of a role). Music is really weird for the genre, but it's pretty good. (It's like weird hard rock)

There is a cash shop and premium and whatnot, but I wouldn't necessarily say it's p2w. It's DEFINITELY pay-to-advance-way-faster, though. but I think you can have a good time with CABAL for free.

Before installing this, know that this is the NA version of the game and there are a few countries restricted and if you're playing from EU you may have some lag but it's playable. I'm from Romania and I'm playing with 400 ms but it's alright.
Now, old players or people who played CABAL before know how the game is, it's features, etc. If you're a returning player and you're thinking of giving this server a try, do so! You get premium for a month and tons of other benefits right now. The economy is new, the server is populated and everyone's still mid to high level. Worth playing.
If you're new to the game and have no idea what the hell this is, here's a quick summary. This is a somewhat fast paced MMORPG that's been on the market for almost 10 years now and it's still awesome. In a way.

Pros:

- Fast paced combat with unique systems such as the combo system which is very entertaining
-  Awesome music
- Graphics? This could be counted as a good thing since that means this will work on older system as well.
- Flashy skills
- Tons of levels

Cons:

- It's Pay2Win - Yeah it is, you can literally buy Alz from the Item Shop. It's not entirely game breaking since you can.. well, I dunno, it would take a ton of time to get a top kek gear set without spending any real cash but still, it's possible.
- Lags if you're not from NA which I believe is something they should add on the main page instead of the forum but oh well, I don't really complain about it. It's playable for me

I guess that's all I can come up with at this time.
I love this game, it's my second MMMORPG I ever played and it's normal that I'd be so inclined to give this one a positive review.
Also, take note that this is my personal opinion about the game.

reviewText:
The game invokes a huge sense of nostalgia within me. Having played this game around 2008/2009, I am glad to see not much has changed - that counts for the bad and good parts though.

Essentially, Cabal Online is a game that is very addicting - it is like Diablo or any Lootathon, except that instead of Loot, you are hunting levels. The game is unique in that your EXP and Skill-EXP are separate - using skills and completing some quests fills up your Skill-EXP, and completing quests and killing monsters your normal EXP. Here is a big bad part of the game though - while leveling up is always fun, later skill levels just take way too long to level up and advance. However, it does have an addicting feeling to it, simply because you know that on the next skill level you get even better looking and more powerful skills.

I always enjoyed Cabal especially because of the Skill system - powerful Auras, Battle Stances and Skills look great and feel good. The game does have an outdated look, but is still okay to look at - and it just has this unique sense of fun when playing it. It is hard to describe, but it is free, so give it a go!

reviewText:
It's still a grind fest game, even after 7 years  I played for an hour and a half trying not to fall asleep at my keyboard.

Pros
Simple leveling system: Quests are pretty much everywhere from lvl 1 to like lvl 90+. Even if you finish all the quests your level, you only need to grind a little bit to reach the next level because the quests give plenty of exp.

Skill Combos: All you have to do is put your skills on the skill bar, then the game takes care of the rest.

Diverse weapons and armor: There are 3 types of armors, Martial, Armor, and Battle. Martial has highest defense rating/evasion, Armor has highest defense, and Battle is right in between. The look of the armors change drastically as you progress through each set.

Cons
Skill Grinding: This is the most daunting task. In Cabal, ranking up in skills give you stat boosts as well as hp/mp boosts. And each rank-up stacks, meaning you gain more boosts as you rank up higher and higher. Which also means, in pvp and dungeons, if you do not have high skill ranks, you will get owned big time. I've heard of lvl 90 characters with master skill ranks get owned by a lvl 60 with transcender skill ranks.

Drop rates: The drop rates have been drastically reduced. This discouraged many players from playing beyond a certain level, hence why so many players quit. The decrease in drop rate only starts to really get noticeable after you reach 70-80 levels. I have heard countless people complain back when I used to play  non-stop, and I believe the original Cabal (korean) company made this decision.

Bots/Gold Sellers/Spammers: Now this is one hell of a major problem in Cabal. There are characters selling gold for real money, bots mindlessly killing mobs in a certain area, and spammers looking to power level people for real money.

Crazy Priced Cash Items:  If you saw the prices on the eCoins and cash shop items, you would have had quite a shock. To receive a 30-day premium, you need to pay roughly $18-20. Now what would you prefer? pay $5 bucks or so extra to play a game where the staff/admins barely even put up an effort to improve their merchandise.

reviewText:
Ok so, I used to play this game in the past and enjoyed it a whole lot back then, and even if I'm gonna try to be as fair as possible in this, do take my words with a grain of nostalgia salt. (also tl;dr version further below)

The game has aged surprisingly well with the graphics being maybe not that great, but not horrid either; the combat is pretty straightforward and it has a pretty interesting skill leveling system where you build up skill experience to achieve new a new rank and acquire new skills or the ability to strengthen old ones. Classes are interesting and the skills that you can get on the higher levels often look pretty cool. Dungeons can be pretty fun to do with friends and especially from he halfway point onwards (which is level 100) dungeons can get pretty intreguing with puzzle-like bits. As you may have guessed from an old game there is a lot of grinding to be had, though the premium you get with a new account makes this a whole lot easier and quicker. (I'm not sure if the premium is gonna be for every new account or just as a one-time thing because it went over to steam)

That however, is where the good points kind of end with the game; grinding is very much a problem once your premium runs out, as you will have to walk everywhere and lose the ability to teleport around the maps; as well as losing a lot of inventory space. At the higher levels you can also run into money problems, as quests stop giving money for some reason and leveling passive skills becomes really expensive. Even with the blessing beads you're given with every new character (gives +200% exp for a month) the grind just becomes a chore. The game also has a lack of variety in armor, having only 3 types of armor and every new tier of armor basically looks the same but with a different color or slight changes (until you start reaching the level 130+ gear). The weapons are okay mind you, but other than for stat purposes I never found myself looking forward to getting new gear. Questing is dull and repeatitive as all quests basically fall into the category of kill things, loot things, talk to things or re-enter this place you just left... things.

Now I know that all things I spoke of are PvE related, but that's the point; even if I'm not a fan of PvP anyway, it takes a lot of grinding to get to the point where you can join PvP events (random dueling aside), let alone stand a chance because everyone and their mom is likely level 200 in there and can one-shot you. (do note I'm not sure about that as I never indulged in pvp with the steam version, but if I'm to believe how it was back in the day, that's how it goes.)

Sooo tl;dr. (for PVE things)

Pros:
Aged okay in terms of graphics.
Interesting classes/skill leveling system.
Interesting dungeons.
Free premium at the start(?).
Cons:
Game becomes a whole lot worse once premium runs out. (not kidding it really breaks the game)
Design of gear is rather stale. (weapons are decent though)
Questing is very dull. (and the main way to level up)
What I recommend with this game is give it a shot (preferably with friends); and if you find it to be fun, play it until the free premium runs out (if that's not a limited event thing). If you can look past all the things you lose after that, good for you, but I wouldn't recommend investing in new premium unless you really really like this game. If a game deliberately becomes horrible without premium I wouldn't support it, but that may just be me.

Another annoyance is that this game doesn't seem to truly start until you finish with all the questing.Up to the point I'm at now it feels like one giant tutorial!Really annoys me but with the exp event going on now it will hopefully be over soon.Other than that and the latency issue,which I hope gets fixed soon,this game is pretty fun if you are looking for a grindy game!
